result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Lovell Whitley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges  including the DNA surcharge during course of probation to the probation agent.  Any bail to apply.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be enteed.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

No alcohol.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm  ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine or any body armor.
May not live where a firerm is present.
May not be in any vehicle where a fiearm is present.
Not to associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact unless approved by the DOC with the following Lestencia V., D.A.H., D.M.W. AND D.D.C.
Comply with all No Contact Orders and injunctions.
Comply with all child suppoort Court orders.  Comply with all paternity orders.

Complete parenting or fatherhood course.
Complete a Cognitive Behavior or Cognitive Intervention Program.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfuly complete recomended treatment  including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid in full by 6/1/2016.  Any cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  Release for work, the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus Lovell Whitley

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order for cancellation of Huber/ Work Release/ Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant to Wisconsin, signed and filed. tk 
Copies mailed to parties.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Stark, Br 17 for review. os
Count two.

Defendant Marcus Lovell Whitley in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Brandon Wigley for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for inmate work assignments and the Day Reporting Center; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is present. 
-Defendant may not be in any vehicle where a firearm is present. 
- Maintain full time work.
- Defendant to not associate with any known gang member, associate or affiliate. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders. 
- Complete Parenting  or Fatherhood course. 
- Comply with all paternity court orders.
-Complete a Cognitive Behavior or Cognitive Intervention Program.
-No contact unless approved by the Department of Corrections with the following: Lestencia V., D.A.H., D.M.W., and D.D.C.
- Comply with all no contact orders and injunctions.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for work, the Day Reporting Center, and inmate work assignments; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, in full by 6-1-2016. Any cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defense requests a delayed report date. State objects to a delayed report date. For the reasons placed on the record the Court denies the Defense request to allow the Defendant to have a report in date.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated May 6, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Lovell Whitley in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT  1 & 2- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 5-7-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated April 6, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Lovell Whitley in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record.  Entry made without court file

Violation report addressed in another court this date.  Defense advised the clerk that the previously calendared plea date should remain.  Case is adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 17.
Justice Point report dated 04-01-15 received and filed
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report re: Missed Telephone Contact, received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Lovell Whitley in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned Projected Plea Hearing on 4-7-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.
Note:  Court REITERATES that the defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Court REITERATES No Contact with Lestencia V., D.A.H., D.M.W., D.D.C., or their residence or place of employment as noted on the Justice Point report dated March 6, 2015. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated March 5, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Marcus Lovell Whitley in court with attorney Scott Paley Phillips Law Offices.  Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
NO DA FILE IN COURT.  Case was originally calendared for Preliminary Hearing on February 23, 2015. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Arraignment scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM007877  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-16-2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marcus Lovell Whitley in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Marcus Lovell Whitley in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
